title.narrative: A Watershed Approach to Enhance Resilience (WATER)

description.narrative:
The project goal is to increase food security and build resiliency of vulnerable households in Makindu district affected by drought. To achieve this goal, LWR and its partners will implement activities that fall under the following objectives and strategies.
Objective 1: Rehabilitate the water supply for production and household use in the Makindu, Kiboko and Ndukangeuke sub catchments while supporting targeted households in meeting their short-term needs Strategies: 1.1 Provide income through cash-for-work for 3,600 vulnerable people to meet immediate household needs in exchange for labour to improve soil and water conservation measures 1.2 Establish community infrastructure to improve water supply for production and household use
Objective 2: Increase targeted producers’ income from production in Makindu, Kiboko and Ndukangeuke sub catchments Strategies: 2.1 Strengthen capacity of producers in good production practices, farming as a business, post-harvest handling techniques 2.2 Increase availability of water for production (improved moisture retention of soil and irrigation) (see strategy 1.2) 2.3 Increase producers’ access to capital to invest in production (see strategy 4.5) 2.4 Increase producers’ capacity in collective marketing (see strategy 4.6)
Objective 3: Support improved health of targeted households in Makindu, Kiboko and Ndukangeuke sub catchments to increase participation in production and collective efforts Strategies: 3.1 Develop capacities of community members to ensure household water is suitable for consumption
Objective 4: Strengthen targeted partners’ capacity to provide quality services to its members Strategies: 4.1 Develop and implement capacity strengthening plans for the five partner organisations that allow them to manage themselves in a transparent and democratic manner 4.2 Develop partner project management and implementation systems 4.3 Link partners and their members to other important technical assistance providers 4.4 Engage in the implementation of sub-catchment conservation and protection plans 4.5 Establish Rural Financing Partnerships for producers to access credit 4.6 Develop mechanisms for collective procurement of inputs and collective marketing of agricultural products
